definitions.definition: To look upon fondly; to prefer.
To encourage, conduce to
To do a favor [noun sense 1] for; to show beneficence toward.
definitions.example: Would you favor us with a poetry reading?

definitions.definition: To treat with care.
definitions.example: Favoring your sore leg will only injure the other one.

definitions.definition: (including) To resemble, to look like (another person).
Of two or more entities, to approach each other; to get closer and closer.
Of a sequence, to have a limit.
Of an iterative process, to reach a stable end point.
Convergence
Approaching each other at a point; convergent.
Part of the exhaust pipe of a car that dampens the noise the engine produces.
A silencer or suppressor fitted to a gun.
A type of scarf.
In the Standard Model, an elementary subatomic particle that forms matter. They combine to form hadrons, such as protons and neutrons.
(X Window System) An integer that uniquely identifies a text string.
(Falkland Islands) The black-crowned night heron, Nycticorax nycticorax.
An investigation or inquiry into the truth of some matter
An inquest
A questioning
The finding of a jury, especially such a finding under a writ of inquiry.
To make inquisition concerning; to inquire into.
To rewrite existing source code in order to improve its readability, reusability or structure without affecting its meaning or behaviour.
definitions.example: The code works, but I must refactor it before it is production quality.

definitions.definition: (writing) To rewrite existing text in order to improve its readability, reusability or structure without intentionally affecting its meaning. Similar to, but sometimes involving more extensive restructuring than, copy editing.
definitions.example: Two significant activities which to contribute to community projects, such as Wikipedia, are to refactor complicated articles into simpler ones, and to refactor duplicated content into reusable templates.

definitions.definition: An act or process in which code is refactored.
